thread.title: Marc Marquez secures 30th career pole ahead of Australian Grand Prix
thread.title_full: Marc Marquez secures 30th career pole ahead of Australian Grand Prix

title: Marc Marquez secures 30th career pole ahead of Australian Grand Prix
text:
Marc Marquez secures 30th career pole ahead of Australian Grand Prix 18 Oct 2015 06:47:00 
comments 
Marc Marquez will start from pole for the 30th time in his MotoGP career on Sunday after topping the timesheets in qualifying for the Australian Grand Prix. 
Marquez rode his Repsol Honda to pole in a time of 1 minute 28.364 seconds, three-tenths of a second ahead of Ducati team's Andrea Iannone, suggesting he is back to full fitness after breaking a bone in his left hand before the Japanese GP. 
Movistar Yamaha's Jorge Lorenzo set an identical time to Iannone, but will start third after the count back - his worst qualifying performance since eighth in Assen. However, the good news for the two-time champion is that the only man ahead of him in the world standings, Valentino Rossi, could only manage seventh place. 
Marquez's team-mate Dani Pedrosa was pushed on to the second row in fourth, alongside LCR Honda's Cal Crutchlow in fifth and Team Suzuki Ecstar's Maverick Vinales in sixth. 
Rossi in seventh will be alongside Aleix Espargaro (Suzuki Ecstar) and his brother Pol in ninth. 
Brits Scott Redding (11th) and Bradley Smith (12th) are on the fourth row alongside Andrea Dovizioso. Related Sport News
